title: Calories in Ketchup
meta_description: Discover calories in ketchup per tablespoon serving, including carbs, sugars, sodium, full nutrition breakdown, and serving tweaks for better choices.
assumptions: Standard tomato-based ketchup (e.g., Heinz-style); 1 tbsp = 17 g; no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, sugar content, and serving size. Check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of ketchup contains about 19 calories, mostly from sugars.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tablespoon of ketchup?
faqs.a: About 19 calories per tablespoon of standard ketchup.
Yes, one tbsp has around 3.9 g of sugars, mostly from added sweeteners.
Approximately 167 mg per tablespoon, which can add up with multiple servings.
Roughly 112 kcal per 100 g; scale based on serving size.

faqs.q: Does ketchup have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Very littleâ€”0.3 g protein and 0.1 g fat per tablespoon.
